word_mean: 符号Sj。编线的松紧程度。对于结构相同的编线，是用单位长度内的花节数量来表示。

sentence.Network_en: Torn muscles retract, and lose strength, structure, and tightness.
sentence.Network_cn: 撕裂的肌肉会收缩，丧失原来的力量、结构和紧实度。

sentence.Network_en: Heart disease often shows itself first as pain or tightness in the chest.
sentence.Network_cn: 心脏病的前兆常常是胸口疼痛或憋闷。

sentence.Network_en: Special connections ensure that the system excellent air tightness.
sentence.Network_cn: 特别的连接方式保证了系统优良的气密性.

entry.def: Tight clothes or shoes are rather small and fit closely to your body.

example.ex: She walked off the plane in a miniskirt and tight top...
example.tran: 她身穿迷你裙和紧身上衣走下了飞机。

example.ex: His jeans were too tight.
example.tran: 他的牛仔裤太紧了。

entry.def: If you hold someone or something tight, you hold them firmly and securely.

example.ex: She just fell into my arms, clutching me tight for a moment...
example.tran: 她正好跌进我的怀里，一时间紧紧地抓着我。

example.ex: Just hold tight to my hand and follow along...
example.tran: 抓紧我的手，跟着我。

entry.def: Tight controls or rules are very strict.

example.ex: The measures include tight control of media coverage...
example.tran: 那些措施包括对媒体报道的严格管制。

example.ex: The Government were prepared to keep a tight hold on public sector pay rises...
example.tran: 政府准备严格控制公共部门的工资增长。

entry.tran: 紧紧地;密不透风地;滴水不漏地
entry.def: Something that is shut tight is shut very firmly.

example.ex: The baby lay on his back with his eyes closed tight...
example.tran: 那个婴儿仰面躺着，两眼紧闭。

example.ex: I keep the flour and sugar in individual jars, sealed tight with their glass lids...
example.tran: 我把面粉和食糖分别放在罐子里，并将玻璃盖子紧紧地盖上。

entry.def: Skin, cloth, or string that is tight is stretched or pulled so that it is smooth or straight.

example.ex: My skin feels tight and lacking in moisture...
example.tran: 我的皮肤感觉紧巴巴的，缺少水分。

example.ex: Pull the elastic tight and knot the ends.
example.tran: 把橡皮筋拽紧，两头打上结。

entry.tran: 紧密的;密集的;装得满满的
entry.def: Tight is used to describe a group of things or an amount of something that is closely packed together.

example.ex: She curled up in a tight ball, with her knees tucked up at her chin...
example.tran: 她蜷缩成一团，膝盖抵着下巴。

example.ex: The men came in a tight group.
example.tran: 那些男人密密匝匝地来了。

entry.def: If a part of your body is tight, it feels rather uncomfortable and painful, for example because you are ill, anxious, or angry.

example.ex: It is better to stretch the tight muscles first...
example.tran: 最好先伸展一下僵硬的肌肉。

example.ex: Sarah came forward with a tight and angry face...
example.tran: 萨拉走上前来，紧绷着脸，怒气冲冲。

entry.def: A tight group of people is one whose members are closely linked by beliefs, feelings, or interests.

example.ex: We're a tight group, so we do keep in touch.
example.tran: 我们关系很铁，所以的确保持着联系。

entry.def: A tight bend or corner is one that changes direction very quickly so that you cannot see very far round it.

example.ex: They collided on a tight bend and both cars were extensively damaged.
example.tran: 他们在一个急转弯处相撞，两辆车均严重受损。

entry.tran: (日程、预算)紧张的，回旋余地不大的
entry.def: A tight schedule or budget allows very little time or money for unexpected events or expenses.

example.ex: It's difficult to cram everything into a tight schedule...
example.tran: 日程紧，很难把所有事情都安排进去。

example.ex: Emma is on a tight budget for clothes...
example.tran: 埃玛预算很紧，没有多少钱买衣裳。

entry.tran: (比赛双方)比分接近的，不相上下的，势均力敌的
entry.def: A tight contest is one where none of the competitors has a clear advantage or looks likely to win, so that it is difficult to say who the winner will be.

example.ex: It was a very tight match...
example.tran: 参赛双方不分伯仲。

example.ex: The most recent polls predict a tight three-way race.
example.tran: 最近的调查显示，这将是一场三方激烈角逐的比赛。

entry.tran: 小气的;抠门儿的;吝啬的
entry.def: If you say that someone is tight, you disapprove of them because they are unwilling to spend their money.

example.ex: What about getting new ones — Are you so tight you won't even spend three roubles?
example.tran: 买些新的怎样——你就小气到连3个卢布也不肯掏吗？

entry.def: If you are in a tight corner or in a tight spot, you are in a difficult situation.

example.ex: That puts the president in a tight spot if the vote is not a resounding 'yes'...
example.tran: 如果投票结果不是一个响亮的“是”，总统的处境就不妙了。

example.ex: They teach you to use your head to get out of a tight corner.
example.tran: 他们教你开动脑筋，摆脱困境。

entry.def: You can say 'sleep tight' to someone when they are going to bed as an affectionate way of saying that you hope they will sleep well.

example.ex: Good night, Davey. Sleep tight.
example.tran: 晚安，戴维。睡个好觉。

means.word_mean: 1. a state occasioned by scarcity of money and a shortage of credit
3. lack of movement or room for movement

auth_sentence.content: You can see the tightness around her mouth.
auth_sentence.res_content: You can see the tightness around her mouth.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: You can see the tightness around her mouth.

auth_sentence.content: There's also tightness in the fabric around the biceps.
auth_sentence.res_content: There's also tightness in the fabric around the biceps.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There's also tightness in the fabric around the biceps.

auth_sentence.content: Even when she's smiling, you can see that tightness.
auth_sentence.res_content: Even when she's smiling, you can see that tightness.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Even when she's smiling, you can see that tightness.
